subject: History
title: The Invention of Quarantine
description: A fast breakdown of The Invention of Quarantine for builders.

hook.text: The word 'quarantine' comes from the Italian quaranta giorniâ€”forty days. Venice invented the concept in 1377.

buildup.text: During plague outbreaks, the city of Ragusa (Dubrovnik) forced arriving ships to anchor offshore for 30 days.

discovery.text: Venice extended this to 40 days. The policy workedâ€”plague spread less in cities that isolated incoming travelers.

twist.text: They had no idea why it worked. Germ theory wouldn't arrive for 500 years. They just noticed the pattern.

climax.text: Quarantine remains our first defense against pandemics. COVID-19 lockdowns followed the same medieval logic.

punchline.text: A 650-year-old idea saved us again in 2020.
